perturbation.original_text: 8. Termination. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon the occurrence of any of the following events: (a) upon the death or bankruptcy of CONSULTANT; or (b) upon the close of business on the date the Company gives CONSULTANT written notice of Termination for Cause (as defined below); (c) ninety (90) days following the date the Company gives CONSULTANT written notice of termination for any or no reason; or (d) CONSULTANT may terminate this Agreement by giving ninety (90) days' written notice to REIT.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Termination. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon the occurrence of any of the following events: (a) upon the death or bankruptcy of CONSULTANT; or (b) upon the close of business on the date the Company gives CONSULTANT written notice of Termination for Cause (as defined below); (c) thirty (30) days following the date the Company gives CONSULTANT written notice of termination for any or no reason; or (d) CONSULTANT may terminate this Agreement by giving ninety (90) days' written notice to REIT.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict in the termination clause. Originally, the company could terminate with 90 days' notice, but now they can terminate with only 30 days' notice, creating uncertainty and a contradiction in the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: Term: twelve (12) months from the date of the Agreement which term shall automatically renew for an additional twelve (12) months on such date if the Agreement is not otherwise terminated according to Section 8 of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Term: twelve (12) months from the date of the Agreement which term shall automatically renew for an additional six (6) months on such date if the Agreement is not otherwise terminated according to Section 8 of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the term automatically renews for twelve months, while the changed text reduces this renewal period to six months. This creates a direct contradiction, leading to uncertainty about the contract's duration after the initial term. This also refers to Section 8, where the above change was implemented, furthering confusion.

perturbation.original_text: 9.7 Indemnity. (a) Indemnity by the Company. The Company hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Consultant against any and all losses, claims, damages, liabilities and expenses (including reasonable costs of investigation and legal counsel fees) to the extent not funded by applicable insurance, in addition to any liability the Company may otherwise have, arising out of, related to or based upon (i) any violation of law, rule or regulation by the Company or the Company's agents, employees, representatives or affiliates or (ii) any third party action or claim against the Company in which Consultant is alleged to be additionally liable. In this regard CONSULTANT shall be an additional insured under Company's applicable insurance coverages. Company shall provide CONSULTANT evidence of all such coverage.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.7 Indemnity. (a) Indemnity by the Company. The Company hereby agrees to indemnify and hold harmless Consultant against any and all losses, claims, damages, liabilities and expenses (including reasonable costs of investigation and legal counsel fees) to the extent not funded by applicable insurance, in addition to any liability the Company may otherwise have, arising out of, related to or based upon (i) any violation of law, rule or regulation by the Company only but not for the Company's agents, employees, representatives or affiliates or (ii) any third party action or claim against the Company in which Consultant is alleged to be additionally liable. In this regard CONSULTANT shall be an additional insured under Company's applicable insurance coverages. Company shall provide CONSULTANT evidence of all such coverage.
perturbation.explanation: This change limits the scope of the company's indemnity obligations. The original text covered violations by the company *and* its agents/employees/affiliates. The modified text removes the indemnity for the actions of agents, employees, representatives or affiliates, creating a conflict regarding the extent of the Company's responsibility. This could cause disputes about whether specific actions are covered by the indemnity.
